original_text:
**INSTITUTION
GENERAL MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[TTT M SSS]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 12 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 13 07]
BRIEF HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS
This is an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old female with past medical history of depression , atrial fibrillation , and COPD who was transferred to the MICU on **DATE[Nov 12 2007] , from **INSTITUTION with respiratory distress .
The patient has been in **INSTITUTION since **DATE[Oct 20 2007] , for worsening confusion without an organic cause .
She had been receiving electroconvulsive therapy , her last treatment being on **DATE[Nov 11 2007] .
Following this ECT , she had progressively increased work of breathing followed by extubation after her procedure .
She had to get some Xopenex which decreased her O2 requirement .
Saturations were 100% on 6 L of nasal cannula .
She got a chest x-ray at that time which showed right - sided opacities suspicious for pneumonia .
The patient was started on Zosyn and vancomycin .
She did have a tracheal aspirate on **DATE[Nov 12 2006] , which showed moderate gram-positive cocci .
The patient has otherwise been feeling well and she was subsequently transferred to the medicine floor for further treatment .
Subjectively , the patient was seen lying in bed .
She had no specific complaints for me .
Asked me to leave her alone .
She denied any chest pain or shortness of breath .
No abdominal pain , nausea or vomiting .
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION
Vital Signs :
Temperature of 37.1 , pulse 80 , respirations 18 , and blood pressure 110/60 .
General :
She is awake .
She is alert and oriented x 2 ; although , she did think that she was at **INSTITUTION .
HEENT Exam :
She has moist mucous membranes .
Her EOMs are intact .
Neck :
Supple .
Heart :
Regular rate and rhythm .
Lungs :
Decreased breath sounds in her right lower lobe and no wheezes or crackles .
Abdomen :
Positive bowel sounds .
Soft and nontender .
Extremities :
Warm and well perfused .
No clubbing , cyanosis or edema .
Her mood is good .
She has no visible rashes on skin exam .
LABORATORY DATA
She had lab work yesterday morning that showed a sodium of 138 , potassium 3.8 , chloride 103 , bicarbonate 20 , BUN and creatinine 10 and 1.6 , calcium 8.7 , magnesium 1.4 , phosphorus 3.9 , total bilirubin 0.5 , ALT 47 , AST 33 , alkaline phosphatase 128 , lactate 1.1 , amylase less than 30 , and lipase 21 .
Troponin was less than 0.1 .
She had a white count of 64.4 , H and H 12.1 and 37 , platelets 280 , and INR was 2.4 .
Her UA did not show any signs of infection .
Chest x-ray showed a large pleural-based opacity in the right mid lung consistent with atelectasis and no pneumonia .
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN
1. Respiratory .
The patient has what is considered a hospital-acquired pneumonia .
She is currently on Zosyn and vancomycin for approximately 8 more days .
If it comes back negative for MRSA , we can likely discontinue the vancomycin ; although , with vancomycin we will check the trough prior to referring for dose .
Otherwise , she has been breathing well and has no complaints to me today .
2. Atrial fibrillation .
She has therapeutic INR of 2.4 .
We will continue with her current Coumadin dose .
3. Depression .
The patient __________ medical issues resolve .
4. Prophylaxis .
She is on Coumadin and Pepcid .
___________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
CRM/gn
D :
**DATE[Nov 13 2007] 02:39:59
T :
**DATE[Nov 13 2007] 07:00:11
R :
**DATE[Nov 13 2007] 07:00:11/gn
Job ID :
345005 /**ID-NUM
Cc:
*** Dictated By :
-**NAME[XXX , RRR M]. ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[WWW XXX]
**DATE[Dec 11 2007] 04:51:51 PM
